section.title: What Is Header Translation?
section.para: Header translation is the process of converting the name of one header name into a new header name or into multiple new header names without changing the functionality of the request.

section.title: What Can the Header Translation Filter Do?
section.para: The Header Translation filter allows you to translate one header name into a new header name or one header name to multiple new header names.

section.title: What Are the Request Prerequisites?
section.para: The Header Translation filter has no request prerequisites.

section.title: How Is the Header Translation Filter Configured?
section.para: The Header Translation filter can be configured by editing the header-translation.cfg.xmlfile. To change your header translation configuration, edit header-translation.cfg.xml at any time. Within header-translation.cfg.xml, you can specify the following element:
The elements and attributes used in the Header Translation filter are described below:

listitem.para: This attribute contains the name of an already present header that you would like to translate. The header is evaluated in a case-sensitive manner.

note.para: You may not have duplicate <original-names> between different <header> names.

listitem.para: This attribute is a space-delimited list of names that you would like the <original-name> translated into.
This attribute removes the original headers. The default value is set to false.

section.title: How Does the Header Translation Filter Work?
section.para: When a request hits the Header Translation filter, it will look for any existing header names that match the <original-name> attribute of the <header> element. The value of that <original-name> will be added to new headers using the list of <new-name> for the new header names. In addition, if the <remove-original> attribute is set to true, the header matching the <original-name> will be removed.
